        handleInteraction
      • handleInteraction(handler: InteractionHandler; s: Shard; i: Interaction): Future[ bool]

Interaction dispatch â€” routes incoming Discord interactions to the correct registered handler.

The single entry point is handleInteraction. Call it from your interactionCreate event handler:

proc interactionCreate(s: Shard, i: Interaction) {.event(discord).} =
  discard await handler.handleInteraction(s, i)

Dispatch flow

  1. Inspect Interaction.kind to determine the category.
  2. Application command (itApplicationCommand) â€” extract the command name and further refine by atSlash / atUser / atMessage.
  3. Message component (itMessageComponent) â€” extract custom_id, try button first, then select.
  4. Autocomplete (itAutoComplete) â€” extract command name and focused option, look up via findAutocomplete.
  5. Modal submit (itModalSubmit) â€” extract custom_id.
  6. Ping (itPing) â€” ignored (returns false).

Error handling

handleInteraction propagates all errors as-is:

  • HandlerError(hekInvalidInteraction) when the payload is missing required fields (command name or custom-id).
  • HandlerError(hekNotFound) when no handler is registered.
  • Any exception raised by your command callback itself.

A typical pattern wraps the call in a try/except:

proc interactionCreate(s: Shard, i: Interaction) {.event(discord).} =
  try:
    discard await handler.handleInteraction(s, i)
  except HandlerError as e:
    echo "dispatch error: ", e.kind, " â€” ", e.msg

Imports

types, registry, slashargs

Procs

proc handleInteraction(handler: InteractionHandler; s: Shard; i: Interaction): Future[
    bool] {....stackTrace: false,
            raises: [Exception, ValueError, HandlerError, KeyError],
            tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Routes the incoming Discord interaction i to the matching registered handler and returns true on success.

Returns false for interaction types that are silently ignored (itPing).

Resolution per interaction kind

  • itApplicationCommand â€” extract command name, map atSlash / atUser / atMessage to the corresponding CommandKind, then find(kind, name).
  • itMessageComponent â€” extract custom_id, try find(ckButton, id) first; on hekNotFound fall back to find(ckSelect, id).
  • itAutoComplete â€” extract command name + focused option, call findAutocomplete(name, option).
  • itModalSubmit â€” extract custom_id, call find(ckModal, id).
  • itPing â€” silently ignored (returns false).

Component fallback behaviour: When a itMessageComponent interaction arrives the dispatcher first tries ckButton. If no button handler is registered it falls back to ckSelect. This lets you use a single custom-id for a button or a select menu without worrying about component type.

Raises

  • HandlerError(hekInvalidInteraction) â€” the payload is missing required fields (command name or custom-id).
  • HandlerError(hekNotFound) â€” no handler is registered for the command / custom-id.

Example

proc interactionCreate(s: Shard, i: Interaction) {.event(discord).} =
  try:
    discard await handler.handleInteraction(s, i)
  except HandlerError as e:
    echo "handler error: ", e.msg
